p.s: If you have a good sense of fashion and design and are interested in embroidery , a home business selling custom bags could be a great way to make extra money or earn a full-time income .
There are many types of embroidered bags to sell , and people buy monogrammed or embroidered custom bags for gifts and personal use .
You can sell to stores or directly to customers at your own online or retail store .
Learn how to start an embroidered bag business .

item.s: Define your target market to determine the type of custom bags you produce .
This is important to help you get the equipment and supplies you need to meet your goals .
It will also help to focus your advertising and marketing efforts .
You can create custom monogrammed makeup bags , tote bags and purses to sell to stores or individuals for bridal parties , gifts or personal use .
Another idea is custom designs sold in a boutique or online store .

item.s: Write out your business plan .
It will help sharpen your goals , and you 'll have a tool you can use to get financing if needed .
Include a marketing and start up plan .
Learn about the custom bags ' market .
Read journals and books about custom embroidery .
Network with suppliers and professionals at events and trade shows .
Join embroidery associations to get the latest news , trends and ideas for how to start an embroidered bag business .
Decide how to produce your custom bags .
Hand embroidery is a good start for a small home business , but to produce in enough volume to make a profit , you 'll probably need an embroidery machine .
Compare the warranty , training and support options of different machines .
Choose a machine that will work on the type of material used for your custom bags .

item.s: Locate suppliers for tote bags , makeup bags , purses , athletic and travel bags and any other materials you decide to work with .
You 'll also need a source for thread , designs and other accessories .
Make up a system for ordering supplies and an inventory of your supplies so that you can order quickly when running low on items .
Find a location for production and sales .
If you choose to produce in a home business , you 'll need a clean space that is large enough to hold your equipment and supplies and some office space for files and administrative tasks .
If you decide to open a store , find a location with good foot traffic near complimentary businesses .
Contact your local government offices to find out what kind of licenses you need .
For a storefront , find out local zoning requirements that affect traffic and parking .
Contact the IRS to find out how to register your company .
Talk to a business adviser about how to start an embroidered bag business .
Work on a plan to deal with financial issues like taxes , accounting , and insurance and liability coverage for your goods and property .
Learn basic business skills , or hire a part time assistant for support .
You 'll have to manage accounting , orders , customer service and marketing .
Create an online presence .
Open a storefront on Etsy or eBay to sell your products to individuals .
Create an e-commerce website to sell wholesale or retail orders .
